holidays.name: Caps Lock Day
holidays.description: A tongue-in-cheek holiday celebrating the overuse, love, or annoyance of typing in all capital letters. It's a day to acknowledge the 'shouting' tone of caps lock in digital communication.

holidays.name: National Nut Day
holidays.description: A quirky food holiday celebrating all kinds of nuts‚Äîpeanuts, almonds, walnuts, cashews, and more! It's a great day to snack healthy, try new nutty recipes, or just appreciate the crunch.
holidays.origin: Established in the U.S. to promote nut consumption due to their health benefits and culinary versatility.
holidays.funFact: Nuts are actually fruits with a hard shell, and some nuts like almonds are seeds inside a fruit, making them technically not 'true nuts.'

holidays.name: International Stuttering Awareness Day
holidays.description: A day to raise awareness about stuttering, promote understanding, and support people who stutter worldwide.
holidays.origin: Founded in 1998 by the International Stuttering Association to bring attention to the challenges and strengths of people who stutter.
holidays.funFact: People who stutter often have unique ways of coping and communicating, showcasing resilience and creativity.
